paper_abstract: The perfectly matched layers (PML) and exterior complex scaling (ECS) methods for absorbing boundary conditions are analyzed using spectral decomposition. Both methods are derived through analytical continuations from unitary to contractive transformations. We find that the methods are mathematically and numerically distinct: ECS is complex stretching that rotates the operator's spectrum into the complex plane, whereas PML is a complex gauge transform which shifts the spectrum. Consequently, the schemes differ in their times-stability. Numerical examples are given. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the non-equivalence of perfectly matched layers and exterior complex scaling
